item.title: Notes on Time Series
item.description: Definition Property Analysis Procedure Trend Trend & Seasonality Lag & Difference Operator ARMA White Noise MA MA Stationarity AR AR (1) Stationarity AR (p) Stationarity AR (p) as MA (∞) Yule-Walker Equations ARMA ARCH & GARCH ARCH ARCH Stationarity GARCH GARCH Stationarity Old Stuff Integration OLS Estimation ML Estimation Model Selection Spurious Regression Cointegration Definition Time series: collection of observations indexed by date \[\begin{aligned}\{y_t\}_{t=-\infty}^{\infty} &= \{y_t\}_{t\in\mathbb{Z}} \\ &= \{ \dots, y_{-1}, y_0, y_1, y_2,\dots, y_{T-1}, y_{T}, y_{T+1},\dots\} \end{aligned}\] Observed sample: \(\{ y_1, y_2,\dots, y_{T-1}, y_{T}\}\) Underlying random variables: \(\{ Y_1, Y_2,\dots, Y_{T-1}, Y_{T}\}\) Stochastic process: ordered sequence of random variables \[\{Y_t\}_{t=0,\pm 1,\pm 2,\dots} =\{Y_t\}_{t\in\mathbb{Z}}\] Probability space: \((Ω,\mathcal{A},P)\) Mapping: \(\{Y_t(\cdot)\}: Ω\mapsto \mathbb{R}^{\mathbb{Z}}\) s.

item.title: Notes on Behavioural Economics
item.description: Basic Ideas Standard Neoclassical Model Behavioural = Non-Standard Model Reference Dependence Behaviour: Endowment Effect Gain–Loss Utility Linear Loss Aversion Non-Linear Loss Aversion Endogenous Reference Formation Choice over Lottery Expected Utility Theory Endogenous Reference Formation with Risk Behaviour: Attachment Effect & Comparison Effect Behaviour: Allais Paradox Prospect Theory Non-Expected Utility Theory Time Preference Saving and Consumption Windfall Spending Sophisticated / Naive Agent Sophistication effect Welfare Effect Procrastination in Infinite Time Monopolistic Market Competitive Market Shrouded Attributes Social Preference textbook 1: (DS) The foundations of behavioral economic analysis

item.title: Notes on Contract & Information
item.description: Literature Lemon Market: Continuous Quality Perfect Information Unknown Quality Competitive Equilibrium Lemon Market: Binary Quality Cheap Repair Expensive Repair Lemon Market: Signalling Timing Strategy Separating Equilibrium Pooling Equilibrium Adverse Selection (MWG Ch 13) Benchmark Unknown Type Competitive Equilibrium Constrained Pareto Optimum Signalling Competitive Car Insurance Market Benchmark Hidden Type Non-Linear Pricing Price Distrimination with Perfect Information Asymmetric Information Literature Microeconomic Theory (MWG) The Theory of Industrial Organization A Primer in Game Theory Lemon Market: Continuous Quality Quality of car: \(s\in [0,\bar{s}]\) pdf: \(f(s) = α s^{α-1}\) cdf: \(F(s) = s^α\) Seller’s type: \(θ_1\) Seller’s preferences: \(\begin{cases}p & \text{sell} \\ θ_1s & \text{not sell} \end{cases}\) Buyer’s type: \(θ_2\) Consumption possibilities: 1 or 0 Buyer’s preferences: \(\begin{cases}θ_2s - p & \text{buy}\\ 0 & \text{not buy}\end{cases}\) Assume \(θ_2 > θ_1\) Perfect Information Trade is efficient since \[\begin{aligned}θ_2 &> θ_1 \\ θ_2s &> θ_1s \\ p + (θ_2s - p) &> θ_1s + 0\end{aligned}\] Conditions for \(p\): \(\begin{cases}p \geq θ_1s & \text{(seller)} \\ θ_2s - p \geq 0 & \text{(buyer)}\end{cases}\) hold with \(θ_2s \geq p\geq θ_1s\) Unknown Quality Given price \(p\) Seller sells if \[\begin{aligned}θ_1s \leq p \\ s\leq \frac{p}{θ_1} \end{aligned}\] Buyer’s expected quality

item.title: Notes on Mechanism Design & Social Choice
item.description: Mechanism Design Problem Environment Mechanism Induced Game Social Choice Function & Implementation Textbook: (MWG) Microeconomic Theory Mechanism Design Problem Reference Environment Set of agents: \(i\in N = \{1,2,\dots, n\}\) Set of possible alternatives: \(x\in X\) \(x\) is single-valued (MWG Definition 21.E.1) Type profile: \(θ = (θ_1, θ_2,\dots, θ_n)\in Θ = Θ_1\times Θ_2\times\dots\times Θ_n\) pdf of \(θ\) over \(Θ\): \(f\) Agent \(i\)’s type: \(θ_i \in Θ_i\) Agent \(i\)’s vNM utility function: \(u_i(x,θ)\) Allow for selflessness Allow for reference Independent private values environment assumption Private value: \(u_i(x,θ) = u_i(x,θ_i)\) Independent type: \(f_i(θ_i)\) s.

item.title: Notes on Mathematics - Optimization and Dynamics
item.description: Optimization Lagrange Method Kuhn-Tucker Method Dual Problem Dynamics Recursive Analysis Finite Markov Chain Backward Induction Optimization Lagrange Method PS11.Q1 Solve \(\max_{(x,y)\in \mathbb{R}^2} x+y\) s.t. \(x^2+y^2=2\) Lagrangian: \[\mathcal{L}(x,y,λ) = x+y+λ(x^2+y^2-2)\] FOC \[\begin{aligned} \frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial x} = 1 + 2λx = 0 && x &= -\frac{1}{2λ} \\ \frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial y} = 1 + 2λy = 0 && y &= -\frac{1}{2λ} \\ x^2+y^2=2 && \frac{1}{4λ^2} &= 1 \implies λ = \pm \frac{1}{2}\end{aligned}\] 1.

item.title: Rmd Template
item.description: Words of Warning Rmd Reference Reference Cheatsheet Inline Code Executed Display Code R Code Chunk R Code (Inline) Code from Other Languages LaTeX Reference Image Reference Plot Words of Warning I use Typora to write my posts. Its WYSIWYG mode usually processes .Rmd file correctly, but gets lost in a file as complicated as this one. Always check twice and preview the .html page.
